page.title: 05Urban Functions in Maltby
page.content: The agricultural village of Maltby was transformed by the sinking of Maltby colliery in 1908.Into the growing town moved thousands of workers, from neighbouring counties and older coalfields such as Scotland and North- umberland. Boosted by NCB investment the colliery remains a major employer and economic force. The growth of manufacturing has diversified employment, with factories stimulated by motorway building. The town has also developed into a middle order service centre, with market,services, shops and entertainment for its own population and the nearby villages. Lastly,expanding estates and improved communications have led to an increase in residential function. Thus in 1985 Maltby is mining town,service centre, industrial focus and dormitory settlement combined.
